body.p: Researchers at San Diego State University may have found the secret to helping the immune system fight off flu before you even get sick. The study found that a powerful synthetic protein, EP67 is able to activate the innate immune system within two hours of being administered.

p.bold: Innate immune induction and influenza protection elicited by a response-selective agonist of human C5a. PLoS ONE, 2012; 7(7): e40303

body.p: New research has found that there is no such thing as a safe tan. According to Researchers at GW School of Medicine and Health Sciences, UV-induced melanin formation (tanning), traditionally thought to protect against skin cancer, has now been shown to be directly involved in melanoma formation in mammals. Cream up!

p.bold: Melanoma induction by ultraviolet A but not ultraviolet B radiation requires melanin pigment. Nature Communications, 2012; 3: 884

body.p: According to a new study we should cut the amount of time we sit down for if we want to live longer. Researchers found that sitting for less than three hours a day could add an extra two years to your life. Furthermore cutting down TV viewing to less than two hours every day could extend a person’s life by almost 1.4 years. All rise!

p.bold: Sedentary behaviour and life expectancy in the USA: a cause-deleted life table analysis. BMJ Open, 2012 DOI: 10.1136/bmjopen-2012-000828

body.p: A new study has found a vaccine that could potentially promote weight loss. Currently only tested on mice, researchers found that after giving mice, which were fed a high fat diet for six weeks, the jab a 10% drop in body weight after four days was noticed. The vaccinations were administered twice; at the start of the study and then a booster vaccination on day 22. A quick fix?

p.bold: Effects of novel vaccines on weight loss in diet-induced-obese (DIO) mice. Journal of Animal Science and Biotechnology, 2012; 3(1)
